txt.en: Chipped ice from the frozen waterfall

Imi makes a famous winter dessert involving finely-shaved ice and the juice of a special berry.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000> NOTE: This quest will be removed from your quest log when the current festival ends. </rgb>

'Good tidings to you, [placeholder]. The Yule season is my favourite time of the year, even though the frosty air can chill your bones to their very marrow.

'We dwarves enjoy a traditional dessert at this time of year. It may not make you feel any warmer, but it is a treat among my folk nonetheless. Alas, I have eaten so much that I have already used up my supply of ingredients to make more. I need more shaved ice and berries from a particular bush. If you could gather them for me, I would be in your debt, [placeholder].

'You can find both of these around the frozen lake just to the west of the gates of Thorin's Hall. The berry-bushes should be on a small island in the centre of the lake. The ice you can chip from a frozen waterfall at the north-west corner of the lake.'

The frozen waterfall and the berry-bushes can be found around a frozen lake to the west of the gate of Thorin's Hall.\n\nImi has asked you to go to the waterfall and pick some berries from a specific bush around the frozen lake.
'This ice is shaved perfectly, [placeholder], and the berries appear to be ripe. This is going to be a wonderful Yule. I can feel it!
Imi is inside Thorin's Hall, near the main entrance.\n\nImi will be pleased to see that you have gathered several berries and some chipped ice for his dessert ingredients.
'A frosty drink is the perfect compliment to a winter chill!'
Chip ice from the frozen waterfall
Bring the ice and berries to Imi
